content.text:
Hi, I'm Michael Kennedy. I'm a software engineer based in Bellingham, WA. Like many students at Western, after living in the dorms my freshman year I decided to move off campus. It was my first time living on my own, and navigating Bellingham's rental market was a challenge. I didn't know how to find roommates, what I wanted in a rental property, whether to seek out a private landlord or a property management company, etc. After doing some research, I realized I needed to be more scrupulous of which company manages a given rental. I came across reviews, forum posts, detailing experiences with mold, broken appliances, unresolved maintenance requests. Having witnessed and experienced how complicated it is to navigate the Bellingham rental market, I knew I wanted to create something to help first-time renters. At the time my skills weren't quite there, and I didn't really know what I wanted to accomplish.
Then in late 2022, ChatGPT was released. I played around with it for a while, and started formulating an idea: what if I scraped reviews for local companies and piped it to ChatGPT? Although the quality of its responses varied based on the input prompt, it did do a good job at ingesting data and making sense of it in a human-readable format. Then it occurred to me: what if I scraped the reviews for companies in the Bellingham area, then piped it to ChatGPT? All of the heavy lifting would be done by the AI, all I would need to do is present it to the end user. I unfortunately got laid off at the beginning of 2024, so I luckily (or unluckily) had plenty of time on my hands.
